SET THE COURSE
The Business Analyst, eCommerce, will support the Digital business and be a key member in creating a best-in-class digital experience for our Tommy Bahama guest. This role supports all digital merchandising activities across the website as well as providing insight into our overall business and online guest experience. The role will support the team and greater organization with reporting and learned insights to highlight opportunities in product strategy and site content.
BE THE ISLAND GUIDE
Develop, create, and maintain a variety of reports to answer relevant business questions, inclusive of daily, weekly & monthly demand and digital KPIs, site merchandising effectiveness, online guest shopping behavior, content engagement and marketing program effectiveness.
Communicate KPIs and metrics to stakeholders in an easy-to-understand format.
Perform ad-hoc reporting and derive actionable conclusions.
Partner with Digital Merchants to understand analytical needs and uncover opportunities in merchandising & product strategy.
Assist in identifying reporting attributes to be built into data structure, allowing for an improved view of the business.
Liaise with IT and developers on merchandising reporting needs.
Power-user of Adobe Analytics, logs enhancements or issues and communicates to organization.
Identify trends and anomalies while developing theories to explain them.
Leverage data across multiple tools to identify new business opportunities.
Attend business planning meetings and recaps.
ESSENTIALS FOR LIFE IN PARADISE
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing or Digital Analytics
Generally, 3+ years’ experience working in a digital environment and using analytical tools to complete business analysis and make strategic recommendations.
2+ years experience using Adobe Analytics
Fluent in Excel & PowerPoint, Microsoft Office Suite
Comfortable working across several reporting platforms
Demonstrates curiosity for the business, innovative and a creative thinker.
Strong oral and written communication skills including the ability to communicate complex ideas in a simple way.
Strong attention to detail
Proactive, flexible and works well in a fast-paced team-oriented environment.
Digital-savvy, has passion for digital shopping, digital experience
Multiple factors will vary the applicable rate of pay for this role, including an individual’s experience, knowledge, and skillset, as well as work location and available budget.
Rate Range: $66,000 to $97,212.50 annually

Title: HEDIS/CMS Stars Data Quality Analyst
Description: Analyzes, reconciles, and evaluates/interprets complex data from various sources, maintaining data consistency and integrity.
Descriptions:
This position is remote in Washington State
Job Summary
Support CHPW’s quality improvement activities, advancing the effectiveness and value of population health and quality initiatives through targeted analytics. This role is integral in driving improved health outcomes and reducing overall healthcare costs.
Essential Functions
Design, develop, and implement analytics, reporting, dashboards, and trend analysis to support internal and external business customers.
Supports or leads projects/initiatives that span departments and hold accountability for providing analytic support.
Manages the analytic component of complex departmental projects, including the annual HEDIS audit.
Builds and performs data validation processes and in-depth analyses to ensure validity of enterprise data used for quality measurement activities such as HEDIS and Medicare Star Ratings.
Works directly with IS&T, Operations, Quality, and external vendors to ensure submission of accurate and complete HEDIS data.
Develops reports and/or dashboards to monitor program and operational performance. (e.g., reporting for key performance measurement activities, including HEDIS, state-based measure reporting and medical record review). Researches performance measurement outliers and identifies root cause.
Analyzes, reconciles, and evaluates/interprets complex data from various sources, maintaining data consistency and integrity.
Collaborates with quality and clinical teams on the design of reporting and analyses to support the implementation and tracking of quality improvement initiatives.
Tracks quality measurement trends and present analytical insights and feedback to management via Tableau dashboards, Excel spreadsheets and PowerPoint presentations.
Conducts routine and complex quantitative analyses and data validation using tools such as SQL, SAS, Excel, Tableau or other analytical software.
Presents analyses/reports in clear and useful format to management and colleagues in other departments.
Works with stakeholders and team to understand business questions and problems and to scope data analysis and reporting requests.
Maintain ongoing quality control of delivered reports through self-review and peer review, ensuring reports have a high degree of credibility with all users.
Complete ad hoc analyses to support internal and external customers.
Works independently with limited direction.
Exhibits initiative in exploring and discovering opportunities to improve corporate performance through data analysis.
Other duties as assigned. Essential functions listed are not necessarily exhaustive and may be revised by the employer, at its sole discretion.

Qualifications
Education
Bachelor’s degree in quantitative discipline such as Mathematics, Statistics, Actuarial Science or Economics, or related field, or an equivalent combination of education and highly relevant experience required.
Experience
Two (2) to four (4) years of experience analyzing healthcare claims/encounter data preferred
Experience with HEDIS and/or quality measurement preferred
Proven analytical and quantitative skills, including experience with managing and modeling of large data sets, required.
Employment Eligibility
Complete and successfully pass a criminal background check
Has not been sanctioned or excluded from participation in federal or state healthcare programs by a federal or state law enforcement, regulatory, or licensing agency
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Ability to take full ownership of projects, meeting scheduled deadlines with minimal supervision.
Display initiative in research beyond the specific assignment
Strong analytical skills and the ability to interpret, evaluate and formulate action plans based upon data
Highly self-motivated, self-directed, and attentive to detail.
CHPW OFFERS ROBUST TOTAL REWARDS
The position is FLSA Exempt (salary) and is not eligible for overtime. The position is also eligible for as an annual incentive based on company, department, and individual performance goals. Full and Part - time employees have the option to enroll in medical, dental, vision and voluntary life insurance benefits, and 401(k) retirement benefits effective the 1st of the month following or coinciding with their start date. CHPW provides a 6% 401(k) employer match, Basic Life, Accidental Death and Dismemberment insurance, short and long-term disability, financial coaching, and wellness programs at no cost.
CHPW employees start earning 17 days of Paid Time Off (PTO) and receive 40 hours of community service for volunteer time, and two floating holidays immediately. The company offers 10 standard holidays, paid jury duty and compassion time.
CHPW offers a monthly stipend to offset work-from-home expenses for roles that are 100% remote.
SENSORY/PHYSICAL/MENTAL REQUIREMENTS
Sensory*:
Speaking, hearing, near vision, far vision, depth perception, peripheral vision, touch, smell, and balance.
Physical*:
Extended periods of sitting, computer use, talking and possibly standing
Simple grasp, firm grasp, fine manipulation, pinch, finger dexterity, supination/pronation, wrist flexion
Frequent torso/back static position; occasional stooping, bending and twisting
Some kneeling, pushing, pulling, lifting and carrying (not over 25 pounds), twisting and reaching
Mental:
Ability to learn and prioritize multiple tasks at a given time and have the capability of handling demanding situations. Analytical/problem solving/critical thinking ability.
WORK ENVIRONMENT
Office environment with frequent environmental exposure to low-grade radiation from computer monitors; fast paced with frequent interruptions.
PROTECTED HEALTH INFORMATION (PHI) ACCESS
All information (written, verbal, electronic, etc.) that an employee encounters while working at CHPW is considered confidential. CHPW employees may encounter protected health information in the regular course of their work at and for CHPW. This position may be exposed to and required to deal with highly confidential and sensitive material and must adhere to CHPW policies, guidelines, and all applicable laws and regulations at all times.

Candidates whose disabilities make them unable to meet these requirements are considered fully qualified if they can perform the essential functions of the job with reasonable accommodation.

This job description is intended to describe the general content and the requirements for satisfactory performance in this position. It is not to be construed as an exhaustive statement of the duties, responsibilities or requirements of this position.

Community Health Plan of Washington is an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to any actual or perceived protected characteristic or other unlawful consideration.
Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities
The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

Title: Facilities Planning Analyst
Description: Gordian (www.gordian.com) is the leader in facility and construction cost data, software and services for all phases of the building lifecycle. A pioneer of…
Descriptions:
Gordian (www.gordian.com) is the leader in facility and construction cost data, software and services for all phases of the building lifecycle. A pioneer of Job Order Contracting, Gordian’s solutions also include proprietary RSMeans data and Facility Intelligence Solutions. From planning to design, procurement, construction and operations, Gordian’s solutions help clients maximize efficiency, optimize cost savings and increase building quality.

Gordian’s Planning Services team is focused on helping clients, make data driven decisions around their operational effectiveness and capital investments. Our services are founded on rigorous observational assessment, benchmarking and analysis, which – when combined with the industry’s largest database of financial and facilities data – help our clients make critical decisions about the future of their facilities.

Often seen as the “engine” of Planning Services, Analysts work in a fast‐paced and collaborative environment to drive detailed data analysis and develop high quality client deliverables. The best Analysts excel in an environment where they learn quickly, take ownership early while managing multiple projects effectively, and embrace a demanding work environment that values ongoing professional growth. We are looking for new analysts to support our business growth.

Location : United States; Remote; Near a major airport

This position works remotely, with up to 40% travel. Travel includes site visits for building assessments, interviews with key facilities personnel, and executive presentations to client leadership.

Responsibilities:
Manage data collection for multiple clients.
Communicate with clients to understand the data and the institutional context.
Process collected data using Excel ensuring data accuracy and integrity.
Analyze data to answer questions like: What story do the numbers tell? What client problems can the data help solve?
Collaborate with managers to ensure accurate data analysis and create deliverables.
Develop executive level presentations to visualize key data findings, communicate the story, and deliver strategic recommendations.
Assist in delivering presentations to clients.
Conduct on-site building assessments to inventory core building assets.
Conduct interviews with facilities personnel to review core building asset information.

Qualifications:
A minimum of a bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
Strong communication and presentation skills
Strong organizational and prioritization skills to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Analytical skills – the ability to have numbers “tell a story”.
Proven success working as both a leader and a learner in a team environment.
The ability to identify project challenges, and judgment on when to escalate and when to solve them independently.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite programs, particularly Excel and PowerPoint.
Experience in Facilities Management and/or Planning and Construction are a plus.
The ability to travel up to 40%
Physical requirements for this role include the ability to walk around a campus environment for 6-8 hours per day, as well as the ability to occasionally ascend/descend a ladder and/or work in outdoor weather conditions as many as several times a month.

Why is this a rewarding position?

Ownership of Projects: Analysts are responsible for all data management, critical thinking, and story-crafting for each of their projects. By working on projects from start to finish, you can learn and develop professionally from the first day you walk onsite to the final presentation delivered to leadership.

Collaborative Environment : Gordian is a dynamic, collaborative company. Working jointly with our coworkers enables us to solve problems, implement new ideas, improve our products, learn from each other, and enhance our team culture.

Professional Development Opportunities : Like any good investor, Gordian is dedicated to growing the value of our best asset: our employees. We have a clearly designed ladder for growth in the Analyst track and are committed to rewarding quality work. Our company culture encourages learning and providing regular feedback to promote growth.

Title: Aftersales Business Analyst
Description: About PACCAR PACCAR, Inc. is a Fortune 500 company established in 1905 and is recognized as a global leader in the commercial vehicle, financial, and…
Descriptions:
About PACCAR
PACCAR, Inc. is a Fortune 500 company established in 1905 and is recognized as a global leader in the commercial vehicle, financial, and customer service fields. PACCAR is a global technology leader in the design, manufacture, and customer support of high-quality light-, medium- and heavy-duty trucks under its internationally recognized brands Kenworth, Peterbilt and DAF nameplates. PACCAR designs and manufactures advanced diesel engines and provides customized financial services, information technology and truck parts related to its principal business.

Your next career move is waiting at PACCAR whether you want to design the transportation technology of tomorrow, support the staff functions of a dynamic, international leader, or build our excellent products and services. Join the PACCAR team today!

Division Information
PACCAR’s Information Technology Division (ITD), located in Renton, WA utilizes cutting-edge technology to provide systems development, consulting, voice and data communications services to the entire Corporation, which has high visibility in the technology sector.

The Role
The Aftersales Business Analyst will be responsible for supporting efforts to manage, maintain and execute on PACCAR’s Global Aftersales Systems Roadmap. The Aftersales Roadmap is a set of technology related initiatives that will drive PACCAR to an industry leading position for Parts, Service and related processes. They will work across PACCAR to gain alignment on Aftersales initiatives, coordinate requirements with business leaders and support efforts to define and estimate work. They will also lead the efforts to capture business requirements for the initiatives on the roadmap, including facilitating User Story workshops and building a product backlog. The Business Analyst will be part of a small team that reports to a Program Manager and includes a Solution Architect as well.

Job Responsibilities
Support the gathering of business requirements for Aftersales initiatives, working in concert with the Program Manager and Architect.
Leverage strong agile skills to capture well-formed User Stories.
Support efforts to define the scope, size and estimates for Aftersales initiatives.
Support the process to recommend technologies and partners who can support the Aftersales roadmap.
Support the process to execute technology selection efforts in support of Aftersales initiatives.
Provide support for a regular global steering committee of Aftersales leaders and periodic workshops.
Develop a strong understanding of PACCAR’s Aftersales processes and systems in order to support the long-term execution of the Roadmap.

Required Experience & Skills
3-5 years of experience as a Business Analyst
Experience with agile practices, including writing User Stories, Estimating User Stories and Building a Product Backlog.
Experience supporting development of funding requests for large, complex technology projects.
Experience working and supporting Aftersales (Parts/Service) in the automotive or heavy equipment industry desired.
Strong Leadership skills and critical problem-solving skills.
Demonstrated leadership with the ability to function independently.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Demonstrated ability to effectively coordinate multiple priorities in a dynamic environment.
Excellent organization and interpersonal skills.

Education
Undergraduate degree in Technology or related field required
Master’s Degree in Technology desired

Physical Demands
Sitting and standing for prolonged periods of time
Ability to travel up to 25%

PACCAR Benefits
As a U.S. PACCAR employee, you have a full range of benefit options including:
401k with up to a 5% company match
Fully funded pension plan that provides monthly benefits after retirement
Comprehensive paid time off – minimum of 10 paid vacation days (additional days are provided with additional seniority/years of service), 12 paid holidays, and sick time
Tuition reimbursement for continued education
Medical, dental, and vision plans for you and your family
Flexible spending accounts (FSA) and health savings account (HSA)
Paid short-and long-term disability programs
Life and accidental death and dismemberment insurance
EAP services including wellness plans, estate planning, financial counseling and more

Diversity & Inclusion
PACCAR is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veteran/Disability corporation. Having a diverse and inclusive work environment ensures PACCAR has the talent needed to conduct business today and in the future by leveraging different backgrounds, skills, and viewpoints. We believe diversity in the workplace increases innovation, results in better decisions, and increases employee engagement.

PACCAR’s IT Division promotes Diversity and Inclusion through mentorship, events, celebrations, and affinity groups. The IT Division has an active Diversity Council and supports initiatives and activities for all. PACCAR supports women through the PACCAR Women’s Association (PWA), Women in Trucking, and Women in Technology International (WITI). Educational awareness programs such as Unconscious Bias, Male Allyship and Inclusive Leadership are just a few of many trainings offered. PACCAR is a supporter of PRIDE and celebrates many different multi-cultural events.

Additional Job Board Information
PACCAR is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veteran/Disability. At PACCAR, we value talent and promote growth and development. We carefully consider numerous compensation factors, including your education, training, or experience. The salary range for the Aftersales Business Analyst is $93,000 - $145,500 annually. Additionally, this role is eligible for a full range of benefit options listed above. This position is also eligible for a holiday gift.

Title: Senior Data Visualization Specialist
Description: This is an exciting opportunity to work for one of the top law firms in the U.S.! Davis Wright Tremaine LLP is looking for a Senior Data Visualization…
Descriptions:
This is an exciting opportunity to work for one of the top law firms in the U.S.! Davis Wright Tremaine LLP is looking for a Senior Data Visualization Specialist to join our team. This position allows the flexibility to be fully remote while working near either our Seattle or Portland offices.
This position is responsible for providing high level support for client program teams, including analyzing data and creating reports and dashboards to support self-service analytics for the firm’s timekeepers and largest clients. It requires someone who is highly detail orientated, exercises sound judgment, and possesses strong administrative, organizational, and interpersonal skills while prioritizing and managing multiple assignments.

At Davis Wright Tremaine, you will find challenging assignments, opportunities for professional growth and community involvement, and a culture of inclusion. DWT fosters inclusiveness and authenticity. Regardless of position, everyone here has a voice and the support is unparalleled.

On a typical day you will:
Service Delivery: The Client Experience Team works to augment the traditional legal services provided to clients through proactive communication, actionable reporting, and strategic client satisfaction initiatives. The Client Experience Data Visualization Specialist is expected to:
Work with lawyers and staff to meet service expectations and address specific problems or opportunities to enable the firm to provide excellent, differentiated service
Work with legal teams and staff departments to help drive service innovation to deliver service more efficiently, effectively, and profitably, including analyzing and visualizing data (using tools such as Microsoft Power BI, Tableau, and Microsoft Excel) to give firm and client leadership operational insight into financial and matter data
Be willing and able to learn new reporting tools and features to identify opportunities to add value to the client team
Drive projects forward with Information Technology, Finance, and other firm departments to create solutions that address client needs and maximize program capacity

Data Analysis and Visualization: The Client Experience Team is focused on creating and utilizing objective performance metrics to help stakeholders, internal and external, understand what should be given priority. The Client Experience Data Visualization Specialist is the primary team member responsible for analyzing metrics and designing reports that help drive business decisions and the achievement of goals. The Client Experience Data Visualization Specialist is expected to:
Interact directly with attorney and client stakeholders to understand their needs and take a user-centered approach to developing data visualizations
Query data using SQL, explore data sources, and merge information from diverse data sources to create rich datasets that enable better decision-making
Create prototypes based on stakeholder requirements to confirm the report design meets the business need
Design, create, analyze, and maintain low-to-high complexity data visualizations, reports, and dashboards (using tools such as Microsoft Power BI, Tableau, and Microsoft Excel) that are intuitive and help decision makers answer questions
Present results and reports to firm and client leadership
Incorporate performance and data quality considerations into report planning and delivery
Manage requirements gathering sessions and the process, including creating documentation and tracking progress in shared collaboration tools (e.g., Asana)
Establish, communicate, and manage best practices for design and data visualization (e.g., chart selection and visual encodings) and help ensure that standards are being met
Create and deliver end-user training and documentation on business intelligence deliverables

Financial and Data Literacy: The Client Experience Team is tasked with improving the efficiency and financial success of high-volume matters. This necessitates an intimate understanding of law firm economics, available levers for increasing profitability, and tools used to manage finances. The Client Experience Data Visualization Specialist is expected to:
Understand basic law firm economics and pricing, including profitability metrics, timekeeper rates, and matter types (e.g., alternative fee arrangements)
Understand the financial performance challenges of each workstream our team supports to create effective visualizations
Support the attorney leads and client teams in identifying inefficiencies and opportunities to optimize cost management and financial performance

Client Communication: Understanding how and when to communicate with our stakeholders, internal and external, can help build trust and strengthen the relationship. The Client Experience Data Specialist will assist in developing formal and informal lines of communication to ensure the firm has a deep connection with our clients within their programs. The Client Experience Data Visualization Specialist is expected to:
Be knowledgeable and responsive as the primary point of contact for data visualizations for the Client Experience Team’s stakeholders, fielding questions and escalating issues as necessary
Be comfortable with initial ambiguity in requirements gathering and offer solutions to lead stakeholders down the right path
Help prepare for and attend business review meetings with the firm’s client teams and their clients

Join us if you have:
2+ years’ experience in legal services or other professional services industry
A high school diploma or GED certification; Bachelor’s degree preferred
2+ years’ experience with business intelligence tools such as Microsoft Power BI, Tableau, and Microsoft Excel
Understanding of Microsoft DAX or Tableau VizQL query languages preferred
Experience with relational databases utilizing SQL to pull and summarize large datasets, report creation, and ad hoc analyses
Demonstrated ability to effectively handle multiple projects simultaneously with high attention to detail and minimal supervision
Demonstrated ability to work in a team-oriented, service focused environment and to handle stressful situations in a calm, composed manner
Strong problem-solving skills, with a focus on how we can provide a solution and not the reasons we cannot
Strong interpersonal and communication skills in English and the ability to effectively communicate the results of analyses, both verbal and written, with all levels of a professional services organization
Demonstrated ability and interest to learn new technologies quickly and independently
Demonstrated proficiency with Microsoft Outlook, Excel, Word, and PowerPoint
Experience with HighQ, Azure DevOps, and Microsoft SharePoint preferred
Availability and willingness to work overtime as needed or requested
Located in Seattle, WA or Portland, OR

Who We Are
Davis Wright Tremaine LLP is an AmLaw 100 law firm with 11 offices nationwide. We are relentlessly committed to client service and look for candidates who share that commitment. At DWT, client service means having empathy for each client’s and each lawyer’s work and personal pressures, business objectives, and legal needs; anticipating their needs; and having the capabilities and commitment to deliver what matters most to them.
What’s in it For You?
DWT offers competitive compensation in addition to ample benefits including but not limited to:
Choice of health and vision insurance plans
2 paid volunteer days for qualifying community service work
Dental plan
Fertility and adoption benefit
Paid sabbatical after 13 years of service
Tuition reimbursement
Commuter benefits
Retirement contribution

This job description intends to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by individuals assigned to this position. It is not intended to include all duties and responsibilities.

The annualized salary range for this position in Washington is $86,000 to $95,000 ($44.10 - $48.72 hourly). Actual pay will be adjusted based on the candidate’s education, training, experience and other job-related factors permitted by law. Full time employees may be eligible for a bonus, health insurance with an optional HSA, long term disability, dental insurance, vision care, telemedicine and virtual short term solution based counseling services, life insurance, Healthcare and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts, subsidized backup care and caregiving resources, 401(k), vacation, sick time, 11 paid holidays each year and an employee assistance program. For full-time employees, the initial vacation benefit is 15 days per year and 11 days of sick leave per year, accrued bi-weekly. Additional voluntary programs include: voluntary accident insurance, voluntary life, voluntary disability, voluntary long term care, and pet insurance. Commuter and Transit programs are also available.


Davis Wright Tremaine LLP embraces diversity, equity and inclusion. It brings out the best of what each individual has to offer and inspires us to build strong and lasting connections with each other, our clients, and our communities.

Diversity, equity, and inclusion are part of the fabric of Davis Wright Tremaine—central to who we are and what we do. Our vision is to foster a culture where all talented individuals—including those who are traditionally underrepresented in the legal profession—can have, and can see, a path to success. In order to support this vision, we request that you voluntarily provide the following demographic data. All self-reported demographic information is stored securely in a manner that is compliant with DWT’s privacy and security policies and is only accessible by authorized members of the Talent Acquisition and HR Departments; it is not shared with any of the hiring decision-makers.

Davis Wright Tremaine provides reasonable accommodations for those who need them to complete the application or recruiting process and for employees who need reasonable accommodations to perform the essential functions of their positions due to a disability or for religious reasons. If you need to request accommodation during the application or recruiting process, please email CarrieMcIntyre@dwt.com.

#LI-BR1

Title: Analyst, Social
Description: Company Description Spark Foundry is a global media agency that exists to bring HEAT – Higher Engagement, Affinity, and Transactions – to brands. By…
Descriptions:
Company Description

Spark Foundry is a global media agency that exists to bring HEAT – Higher Engagement, Affinity, and Transactions – to brands. By combining flawless media fundamentals with aggressive innovation, Spark inspires consumers to pay more attention; to care more about our clients’ brands; and to buy more products and services from them.
Balancing the nimble spirit of a startup with the powerhouse soul of Publicis Media, Spark Foundry delivers the best of both worlds to a client roster that spans some of the world’s best and most beloved brands and companies. We combine boutique-caliber insights and service with the buying clout and first-look access of a global leader, bringing the heat to challenger brands that want to act like giants, and to giant brands that want to act like challengers.
With a bottom-up culture that celebrates diversity and aims for all voices to be heard, Spark has become a magnet for the industry’s best talent, with one of the best retention rates in the industry. And by applying a whole-person approach to professional and personal development, Spark develops a workforce that is well prepared for today’s challenges, and also poised to create meaningful careers in the years to come.
Because we know that heat arises the intersection of complementary forces, our professionals come from myriad disciplines and backgrounds: data, analytics, and insights; content and creative production; communications and strategy; finance and marketing; and sociology, psychology, and other liberal arts disciplines.

Job Description

The Social Analyst is responsible for monitoring and maintaining media campaign development and activation on social channels. The ideal candidate requires proficiency in math, strong analytical skills, attention to detail, as well as creativity and an overall interest in and understanding of how consumers leverage social media in the decision path. They require participation in and completion of our agency wide, entry-level training program and our social-specific training track.
Role Objectives:
Gather research necessary to build a new campaign
Traffic approved plan
Monitor and maintain campaign budgets, pacing, and bid adjustments
Manage the performance of active campaigns and keep tabs on competitive landscape
Utilize bid management tools as well as Facebook, LinkedIn, Pinterest, Twitter, Instagram, Snapchat social platforms to build campaigns, QA, implement optimizations, and pull reporting
Develop optimization recommendations in partnership with Manager
Pull and analyze data to inform campaign reporting and help to build insights
Granular maintenance of monthly billing cycle
Resolve all billing discrepancies in partnership with client strategy and billing reconciliation team
Learn all relevant tools for reporting, analytics, and competitive analysis
Work closely with Manager to establish priorities and manage workload
Timely delivery of all work is required
Stay informed on social industry trends and new tools and ad formats
Successful completion of training programs and requisite certifications required

Qualifications
Some professional paid media or internship experience preferred
Experience in social media marketing preferred
Proficiency in MS Suite: Excel, Word, PowerPoint
Strong quantitative skills, including analytical abilities and math proficiency
Solid verbal and written communication skills, detail oriented, and demonstrable organizational skills
Demonstrated critical thinking and problem solving skills
Ability to work within a team, handle multiple assignments and meet tight deadlines

Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
Compensation Range: $46,500-$63,000. This is the pay range the Company believes it will pay for this position at the time of this posting. Consistent with applicable law, compensation will be determined based on the skills, qualifications, and experience of the applicant along with the requirements of the position, and the Company reserves the right to modify this pay range at any time. For this role, the Company will offer medical coverage, dental, vision, disability, 401k, and paid time off

Title: Business Data Analyst - Auburn, WA
Description: MIRACORP Inc. is a veteran, woman-owned firm specializing in federal government contract services. One of our competitive advantages is that we provide…
Descriptions:
MIRACORP Inc. is a veteran, woman-owned firm specializing in federal government contract services. One of our competitive advantages is that we provide services to our customers with a standard of excellence that is unmatched.
We are seeking an entry-level Business Data Analyst to work at our federal customer site in Auburn, WA and to join our collaborative, innovative, customer-centric culture. If you have basic knowledge in technical fields including but not limited to finance, accounting, information technology, research and analysis, or other program support fields, then please read on!
Specific tasks include but are not limited to the following
Works in support of the general management and business operation of a particular program, department, or office.
Provides analysis and research for specific projects.
Supports managers and a variety of tasks and projects to meet deadlines.
Continuously exercises discretion and independent judgment on the analysis, planning, and/or implementation of important program initiatives.
Maintain a wide variety of leasing/real estate records
Verify statistical reports for accuracy and completeness
Compile information and handle/adjust discrepancies in records or transactions
Assist in a variety of administrative matters
Your Experience
Must be a U.S. Citizen
Associates Degree or equivalent experience. Equivalent experience includes:
4+ years experience supporting program analysis activities with no related degree; OR
2+ years experience supporting program analysis activities with related Associates Degree; OR
No experience with a related BA or BS degree.
Experience in Smartsheet or related software such as Workzone, Trello, Google Forms, or Asana is highly preferred.
Strong Microsoft Excel skills
Specializes in one or more of the following areas: tax; finance; accounting; budgeting; auditing; quality control; research; legal and regulatory compliance; administration, and other similar management and operational activities.
Superior customer service, interpersonal, and communication skills.
Ability to take the initiative and use independent judgment.
Preferred
Has a Public Trust Clearance
Why Consider This Opportunity
Great benefits package that starts on the first day of employment:
Personal Time Off, Vacation, Sick Leave
Medical Insurance
Vision Insurance
Dental Insurance
Flexible Spending Account Options
Short Term Disability, and Long Term Disability

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst III (Digital Marketing + Email)
Description: Get to know The Pokémon Company International The Pokémon Company International, a subsidiary of The Pokémon Company in Japan, manages the property outside…
Descriptions:
Get to know The Pokémon Company International
The Pokémon Company International, a subsidiary of The Pokémon Company in Japan, manages the property outside of Asia and is responsible for brand management, licensing, marketing, the Pokémon Trading Card Game, the animated TV series, home entertainment, and the official Pokémon website. Pokémon was launched in Japan in 1996 and today is one of the most popular children's entertainment properties in the world.
Learn more online at Pokemon.com and on Facebook (facebook.com/pokemon), YouTube (youtube.com/pokemon), Twitter (twitter.com/pokemon), and Instagram (instagram.com/pokemon).
Get to know the role
Job Summary: The business intelligence analyst will drive change for the marketing organization through influence of analytics and data insight capabilities within The Pokémon Company International. This position will be primarily responsible to deliver against marketing analytics roadmaps and deliver recommendations across marketing teams (Digital Marketing and Email channels). This role will function as an analytic SME for the Email and Digital Marketing stakeholders and act as the analytical engine of the company to provide insights, support and optimization on email marketing campaigns and web analytics for Pokémon.com. In addition, this position will assist with the data strategy and measurement optimization for our digital presence and marketing initiatives. The ideal candidate must have excellent communication skills, be self-directed, collaborative, drive accountability and have a keen ability to analyze data to identify and communicate patterns.
FLSA Classification (US Only): Exempt
People Manager: No
What you’ll do
Own all parts of the analytics analysis from design, development, analyzing, interpreting, and summarizing data findings to Email and Digital Marketing Teams
Identify valuable patterns and insight across Email and Digital marketing teams to drive impact on improvements for the marketing organization
Drive recommendation and optimization solutions for automating data collection on marketing platforms and products
Analyze data using statistics and other methodologies to solve business problems such as A/B testing recommendations
Become an analytic SME for high value and high impact projects to represent BI interests
Own and deliver the BI roadmap for each workstream for marketing pillars
Integrate relevant information and disparate data sources in developing analysis, insights, and recommendations
Effectively scope, size, and plan the development of analytical solutions and set expectations accordingly
Create dashboards and visualizations to track key performance indicators and effectively communicate trends
Work with marketing leadership to identify marketing goals, KPI and data strategy
Provide support for marketing product launches from analytics perspective
What you’ll bring
Five (5) to seven (7) years of data engineer, data analytics, marketing analytics or related analytics field experience.
Bachelors degree required.
3+ years or more providing analytics in the marketing space
Experience with Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics or similar web analytics tool
Experience with data visualization through Looker, Tableau or similar tools
Expert user of SQL for data analysis
Excellent statistics background and ability to explain analytical methodologies to simply and thoroughly
Ability to work and communicate across multiple marketing teams and marketing domains
Experience with modern programming languages (Python, JavaScript, etc.) a plus
Experience in marketing optimizations methodologies like A/B testing a plus
How you’ll be successful
Passion for Pokémon: Develops an understanding of the Pokémon brand, the impact it has on our people, culture, business, fans, and communities, and applying that knowledge and passion to everything you do.
Challenging the Expected: Approaches challenges with curiosity and creativity, embracing the possibility of failure as an opportunity to learn something new, develop innovative ideas, solve complex problems and identify unique opportunities.
Integrity and Respect: Demonstrates integrity and respect by leading with empathy, listening to others, seeking out different perspectives, and taking personal responsibility for decisions, actions, and results.
Dedicated to Quality: Takes ownership to maintain and promote high standards, looks for new ways to learn and improve, and embraces a growth mindset to seek and apply feedback from others in an effort to continuously improve.
Building Relationships: Develops and strengthens relationships, adopting a “team first” mentality and working collaboratively to solve problems and meet shared goals.
Delighting Customers: Listens and understands the interests and needs of our customers and stakeholders, making them feel heard and important, and embracing these learnings to continue delivering a unique Pokémon experience.
What to expect
An employee first culture
Company events that celebrate the spirit of Pokémon
Competitive cash-based compensation programs
Base salary range: $102,000.00 - $152,000.00. This range is applicable for the labor market where the role is intended to be hired. For this role, new hires generally start between $102,000.00 – $120,650.00. Final base salary is directly related to each candidates' qualifications and professional experience uniquely.
100% employer-paid healthcare premiums for you

Title: Business Analyst
Description: About Us At Hiya we are on a mission to modernize voice with trust, identity, and intelligence. We're protecting everyday people from spam and fraud calls,…
Descriptions:
About Us
At Hiya we are on a mission to modernize voice with trust, identity, and intelligence. We're protecting everyday people from spam and fraud calls, connecting businesses with their customers, and helping carriers secure their networks for all. In 2015, Hiya founder, Alex Algard, saw the increasing need for innovation in the voice channel and began building the first caller ID and spam-blocking apps for mobile while at Whitepages. In early 2016, Hiya spun out of Whitepages and brought its technology to market through Samsung Smart Call, the first-ever network-based spam solution with AT&T, and the Hiya consumer app. Three years later in 2019, we brought Hiya Connect to market, a B2B branded call service that enables enterprise companies to connect to the consumers they are trying to reach. The combination of Protect, Connect, and the Hiya app has resulted in the world's largest Voice Performance Platform with over 400M monthly active users.
About the Position
The Business Analyst role is an individual contributor position responsible for conducting diverse data analysis in order to illuminate mission-critical business insights at Hiya. Your conclusions will be used to identify, measure, and drive focus for our team's progress in sales and financial targets. This includes actively maintaining and evolving quantitative views on opportunity sizes and situation analysis.
We're excited about you because you're the kind of person that is excited to work across business teams to build a perspective on how our diverse data sets can be used to answer critical business questions. You're a self-starter that can hold yourself accountable for delivering results while being adaptable to an evolving start-up environment.
What You'll Do
Own the design, development, automation, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to drive key business decisions. Educate and train users to drive the usage of reports. Simplify and manage the lifecycle of reports that are no longer necessary.
Engage directly with internal business teams to determine and document KPIs and Business Intelligence requirements.
Respond to (and anticipate) high-priority requests from senior business leaders.
Recognize and adopt standard methodologies in reporting and analysis. Use data mining, model building, and other analytical techniques to develop and maintain forecasts to progress sales and financial targets.
Learn and understand an increasingly broad range of Hiya's data resources and know when, how, and which to use and which not to use based on technology and business context.
What You'll Need to Succeed / Qualities that will make you successful:
You are comfortable creating clarity where it does not currently exist.
You are both analytical and creative at solving complex problems.
You follow through on initiatives.
You don't sacrifice good for great.
You are collaborative, inclusive, and decisive.
You can wear multiple hats to get the job done.
You are undaunted by a startup environment (high ambiguity, high urgency, fast-paced, low support structure), and eager to be part of building something new and important.
The person in this role must embody Hiya's key values of: Serving our customers, Doing rather than observing, Improving ourselves and our business, Owning and holding ourselves accountable for success, and Leading by showing up with a POV, engaging in discussion, listening respectfully to others opinions and committing to decisions.
You will have a fast start if you have experience:
3-5 years experience in a similar role, working cross-functionally with real-world, complex datasets.
Strong quantitative reasoning, aptitude for discussing business performance in terms of data points, and ability to quickly learn new business lines, technology enablers, and data sources.
Outstanding verbal/written communication & data presentation skills, including effectively communicating with both business and technical teams, using email, Google Docs, Google Sheets, Google Slides, and Lucidcharts (or MS-equivalents Excel, Visio, and PowerPoint).
Strong SQL skills are required, and knowledge of data processing tools such as Apache Spark and Python. Databricks experience would be useful.
Working experience with Business Intelligence tools such as PowerBI, Tableau, Looker, Sisense, etc.
Experience with Salesforce and SFDC integrations.
Experience translating business needs into requirements, and detailing through an agile, iterative process using JIRA or similar collaboration tools.
Demonstrated ability to frame complex analytical problems and extract as well as articulate insights that led to tangible business results.
A pattern of being self-started, self-taught, and proactive. You are your own QA team, producing quality analysis and building novel ways to ensure accuracy.
Organized, detailed oriented, and able to prioritize and communicate status to partners.
Bachelor's degree preferred.
The requirements listed in the job descriptions are guidelines. You don't have to satisfy every requirement or meet every qualification listed. If your skills are transferable we would still love to hear from you.
More Details
The Base Salary for this role is between $100,000- $120,000. When determining compensation, a number of factors will be considered: skills, experience, job scope, location, and competitive compensation market data.
Start Date: Dependant on the candidate
Status: Full-time
Location: Seattle (Hybrid)
Department: Business Operations
Reports to: Senior Manager of Business Operations
Direct Reports: No
Benefits
Equity compensation
401K program with a 3% match through Fidelity Investments
Self-managed vacation plan
15 Paid holidays including Recharge Days
100% covered medical, dental, and vision for the employee and 50% coverage for dependants
Flexible spending, health savings accounts, and Pretax dependent day care savings plan
Paid parental leave
Voluntary Life and AD&D, and Accident insurance options
Employer-paid life insurance
Employer-paid long-term disability coverage (in qualifying states)
Donation Matching for a charity of your choice (up to $1,000/ year)
$1,000/year reimbursement in Professional Development funds
This position is based in Seattle, WA, USA.
We are building a team with a variety of perspectives, identities, and professional experiences. We evaluate great candidates through a business lens and we strongly believe that diversity and unique perspectives make our company stronger, more dynamic, and a great place to build a career.
Our team has won various awards over the last 4 years from Built-in Seattle and Seattle Business Week to #86 on Deloitte Technology Fast 500 and Forbes #1 Startup Employer. Here at Hiya, we are a people-centric company focused on helping each and every one of our employees grow both personally and professionally. We feel that creating a team culture of support and empowerment to challenge the status quo results in an energized and passionate team that is continuously challenged and passionate about the work they are doing. You'll love working here if you are looking for an innovative challenge that is disrupting an industry. Come join us!

Description: Remote 8-5 PST Want to be part of an amazing team, hell-bent on crafting a better future? We're always looking for creative people who care! We are…
Descriptions:
Remote 8-5 PST
Want to be part of an amazing team, hell-bent on crafting a better future? We're always looking for creative people who care!
We are consultants. Strategists. Creators. Doers. Achievers. Explorers. Geeks. Hipsters. Leaders. Learners. Renegades. Seekers. Visionaries. And we fundamentally believe that we're better together.

We're looking for a Business Outcomes Analyst to support the Global Customer advocacy Program (GCAP) within the Microsoft Cloud Marketing organization to drive impact with one of our leading client teams.
This world-class, highly visible team supports several Microsoft teams including sales, marketing, analyst relations, and events. This team is on a mission to grow the number of advocates who are excited to share their experience leveraging Microsoft's leading solutions (Azure, Microsoft Dynamics 365, Modern Work, Microsoft 365, Power Platform among others) to accelerate innovation and drive business results.
In this role, the Business Outcomes Analyst will be partnering closely with multiple teams (Customer Solution Area Leads, Project Managers, and Clients) to keep consistent, up-to-date process and documentation of the group. You will help drive stability and improvements around the structure of the program. Your work internally will help solidify the long-term operational vision within Microsoft's GCAP space. This individual is responsible for:
Interpreting data to help inform strategy and provide actionable insights.
Ability to organize content of all internal processes and maintain current workflow documentation.
Ability to extract data from dashboards.
Create pivot tables from the data.
Support any ad-hoc project work related to optimizing the GCAP business rhythm motions.
Consolidate inventory of ALL SOP content into one centralized repository using standard version control methods:
Including but not limited to:
Playbooks
Process or procedure documentation
Current repository clean-up and organization - SharePoint, OneNote, Content mapping (site mapping), Azure DevOps project boards, etc.
Interview subject matter experts or owners to understand concepts for documentation to drive clarity and work towards improvement.
Identify and evaluate best in class tool for internal operations at GCAP
What you bring:
3+ years of marketing experience in the B2B space, preferably in a customer-facing role.
Proven experience collaborating with cross-functional teams from multiple agencies to achieve the same goal.
Excellent communication skills and the proven ability to influence multiple levels of the organization.
Results-focused with a deep sense of accountability and experience driving large projects from start to finish.
Proven ability to think strategically and creatively, while maintaining great attention to detail.
Passion for customer experience, nurturing customer relationships at scale and 1:1
Strategic mindset including interpreting data to inform strategy and execution.
Natural leader with the ability to educate and influence with high levels of ambiguity and tight deadlines.
Exceptional ability to develop strong collaborative relationships with a variety of global partners.
Experience managing processes and systems to achieve shared goals across teams.
Proficiency in Microsoft Outlook, Teams, PowerPoint, Excel, Teams and SharePoint.
Microsoft experience a plus.
Who you are:
You have top-notch interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills; you communicate effectively with stakeholders, team members, and senior managers.
You understand why customers are crucial in today's marketing arena.
You manage ambiguity with unwavering persistence; you drive workgroups to consensus and meaningful outcomes.
You are collaborative to the core, with a demonstrated ability to work in a team environment as a leader and a member.
You are a highly proactive, highly organized, self-starter capable of effectively managing several projects simultaneously with impeccable attention to detail.
You are self-sufficient: you can work with little direct supervision, but you know when to ask for help.
You are highly motivated to accomplish recurring tasks and solve problems with strong focus and follow-through.
You demonstrate positivity and optimism.
You are comfortable working remotely.
Would you like to join a global organization that...
Embraces work-life balance – our employees' well-being remains a top priority for us
Promotes a culture of learning and advocacy across the globe - diversity will enable us to strengthen our impact
Encourages innovation and experimentation
Understands that changes will occur and adaptability is crucial to assist when it does
Emphasizes and rewards collaboration
Works remotely. We continue to safeguard the health of our employees so our interviewing and on-boarding process will remain virtual until further notice
Compensation Range: $60,000-$65,000

Title: SENIOR SAP MASTER DATA ANALYST - HYBRID
Description: Description Summary: Trident is seeking a Senior SAP Master Data Analyst to join the Trident team to work on an exciting strategic initiative. This is a…
Descriptions:
Description

Summary:
Trident is seeking a Senior SAP Master Data Analyst to join the Trident team to work on an exciting strategic initiative. This is a critical global transformation to improve supply chain efficiency, deliver world-class sales performance, and provide the fuel to rebuild its infrastructure, including its vessels and Alaska factories. The company has selected SAP S/4HANA as its future ERP system, transitioning from a legacy JD Edwards platform in the US and Japan, and an older SAP instance in Europe. This will be an IT support role for the new S/4 HANA ERP system. This position reports to the Global Master Data Leader.
This hybrid position will be a combination of remote and onsite at the Trident Support Center office in Seattle, WA. Our hybrid work environment includes remote on Monday and Friday and in the Support Center on Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday.
Key Responsibilities:
The Master Data Senior Business Analyst will be responsible for creating and maintaining Master Data in the Trident S/4 HANA system.
Operate as SAP Master Data content expert and work with business users to analyze data integrity, completeness, consistency, accuracy, timeliness, conformity, and validity
Drive comprehensive master data creation & maintenance processes in SAP and across Trident master data processes
Work with reporting team to build auditing tools that find gaps or errors in master data
Define oversight reporting requirements
Execute mass maintenance jobs and utilities according to business requirements
Ensure full population of required SAP master data across the business enterprise
Work with Program Managers and Product Development relating to new product introduction processes.
Master data entry management within SAP (Dev/QA/Prod landscapes)
Support the creation of product specifications and labels and make recommendations for future processes
Communicate with, FSQA, R&D, Quality, Planning, Pricing, and Sourcing as first line of support for Master Data questions
Validate the integrity of material data provided by other functions
Highlight and rectify minor issues with the processes or tools in a timely and collaborative manner • Generate reports for missing and incorrect data
Lead, train, and develop the master data team to follow implemented improvements Senior Master Data Analyst Requirements:
Execute master data creation and maintenance in accordance with established standard operating procedures, templates/mapping documents, service level objectives, and Trident seafoods project plans.
Complete/processe SAP data loads utilizing data workflow tools, load templates and corresponding programs, mass change transactions, and/or direct entry depending on the situation.
Perform some evening/weekend work to minimize impact to the business.
Enforce gatekeeper processes requiring appropriate data and approvals to ensure compliance.
Uphold SAP master data standards by validating/normalizing/cleansing data to ensure adherence to technical and business rules, naming conventions, abbreviations, etc.
Run error reports and/or pulls data to identify inconsistencies and data load corrections.
Perform periodic data audits.
Function as a master data knowledge resource by helping the business understand master data and the data workflow tools used to request adds/changes (level 1 support).
Document data issues engaging Manager to work with the business and technical teams as needed to reach resolution.
Provide business and third parties such as customers, warehouses, and consultants with ad hoc reporting as directed.
Work with a Master Data Lead and Trident Seafoods business analysts, data stewards and individual business data object owners to understand rules and data setup for new requirements due to system enhancements, process improvements, and/or business rule changes.
Provide testing support for key implementations.
Maintain logs/shared files to document master data activity for projects, status reports, and internal audit and compliance processes.
Create/maintain standard operating procedures, user request forms, and other documentation to promote data consistency.
Provide cross-training/shares knowledge with teammates to build skills across the master data team.
Continuously improve knowledge of master data to better understand how data elements are used both technically and by the business.
The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. The person in this position may perform other duties as assigned.
Minimum Requirements
Experience:
The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required:
Proficient in SAP MM/PM/WM/SD/FICO experience is preferred.
Minimum 5 years of experience using SAP or ERP system, with focus on Master Data governance or support.
Bachelor's degree in supply chain, business management, or operations management preferred
Demonstrated ability to deliver quality customer service and experience working in a food and manufacturing setting
Experience in the seafood industry preferred.
Strong organization skills with ability to multi-task and manage multiple priorities simultaneously Experience with Lean, Agile, and Six Sigma tools is a plus
SAP Variant Configuration experience a plus
Strong cross-functional knowledge of master data usage across the supply Strong organizational skills
Articulate communicator
Quick learner and motivated team player
Advanced user of Microsoft Office applications, especially Excel.
Strong research, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
Highest level of accuracy and attention to detail.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, interpersonal skills, and a strong work ethic.
Proven success working in a team environment.
Adaptability and flexibility in a fast-changing environment.
Ability to work well with others in fast paced, dynamic environment
Direct experience managing master data across in SAP S/4 HANA and in Fiori in a large enterprise
Education:
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, business administration, management information systems, mathematics, or engineering or equivalent work experience.
5+ years of Master Data support, reflecting increasing levels of responsibility.
Project Management Professional (PMP) certification preferred.
Qualifications:
The individual selected for this position must have cross-functional leadership skills and the ability to navigate and lead decisive discussions with various levels of the organization
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Demonstrated ability to communicate clearly with all levels across the business.

This is a Salaried – Exempt position with an annualized salary range of: $120,000 - $145,000.
Employees (and their families) are eligible for medical, dental, vision, and basic life insurance, HRA/HSA with employer contribution, EAP, wellness programs, and annual discretionary bonuses. Employees may enroll in Trident’s 401k plan with partial employer match and adoption assistance. Group rates for long- and short-term disability, and supplemental life & disability insurance. Employees will also receive 3.08 hours paid vacation and the greater of 2.16 hours of paid sick time per two-week pay period or 1.00 hour per 40 hours worked and ten paid holidays throughout the calendar year, along with paid parental leave.

Title: Ecommerce Business Analyst - International
Description: Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the third largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in fourteen countries…
Descriptions:
Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the third largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in fourteen countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco ranks seventh in Forbes “World’s Best Employers”.
This is an environment unlike anything in the high-tech world and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture. The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes. Our employees and our members come FIRST. Costco is well known for its generosity and community service and has won many awards for its philanthropy. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others.
Come join the Costco Wholesale IT family. Costco IT is a dynamic, fast-paced environment, working through exciting transformation efforts. We are building the next generation retail environment where you will be surrounded by dedicated and highly professional employees.
Business Analyst will work closely with end users, user experience designers, business unit representatives, development architects/engineers, quality assurance, and others in all stages of the project lifecycle, including discovery, design, development, testing, and implementation.
This position will be responsible for developing detailed business requirements, process flow diagrams, user journeys, along with other appropriate standard analysis artifacts. The individual in this role will be involved in program/project implementations, as well as support multiple customers and stakeholders throughout the project life cycle to help realize business benefits and define a set of business requirements and user journeys that will translate into valuable business solutions and technology systems.
If you want to be a part of one of the worldwide BEST companies “to work for”, simply apply and let your career be reimagined
ROLE
Defines and communicates requirements, risks, and issues that may require changes to plans or scope.
Collaborates with the QA Team to ensure acceptance criteria are easily translatable to test scripts.
Leads and participates in User Acceptance Testing/demos for confirmation of requirements implementation prior to deployment.
Assists the development team with the translation of business requirements into functional or non-functional specifications.
Ensures appropriate stakeholders are involved, obtains required information for capturing and validating requirements and other artifacts, and manages changes and conflicts during the requirements gathering process.
Prepares artifacts in a clear, explicit, and presentable format.
Possesses product knowledge and process improvement skills with a demonstrated ability to effectively propose solutions.
Identifies, builds, and manages stakeholder relationships (i.e., business partners, users, vendors, customers, project team members, and management leaders).
Evaluates project complexity, assumptions, constraints, and dependencies to determine the appropriate business analysis approach.
Leads in requirements gathering and project scoping.
Manages product requests for enhancements and makes recommendations/provides feedback to the development team for enhancement implementation.
Supports the business post go-live and creates and/or assists in the training of the process in the new system.
Identifies and resolves problems, often anticipating issues before they occur or before they grow; develops and evaluates options and implements solutions.
Identifies opportunities for streamlining and increasing effectiveness through continuous process improvement.
Stakeholder and team interaction:
Determines business influence and relationship needs.
Builds and manages business relationships including business partners, end users, suppliers, customers, project team members, and management leaders.
Interacts with technical team(s) to translate functional specifications into technology solutions.
Elicitation and communication:
Ensures appropriate stakeholders are involved and obtains required information for capturing and validating requirements, journeys, and other artifacts.
Organizes and synthesizes large amounts of information provided by stakeholders.
Develops business analysis artifacts (use cases, customer journeys, business models, etc.) to document “as-is” and “to-be” requirements.
Prepares artifacts in an understandable and presentable format.
Leads and participates in Business and User Acceptance sessions for confirmation of requirements.
Requirements management process:
Prioritizes requirements effectively based on appropriately identified factors.
Ensures that all requirements and journeys support the delivery of business value, fulfill goals and objectives, and meet stakeholder needs.
Collaborates with solution architects, process specialists, software developers, and other project stakeholders to design exceptional user experiences.
Analyzes and evaluates current user interfaces and proposes usability improvements.
Conducts competitive analysis research to better understand prevalent interaction solutions.
Creates interactive simulations/prototypes to help project teams, stakeholders, and users explore and understand proposed business solutions.
Manages requirements, traceability, and future reuse.
Identifies and communicates risks and issues that may require changes to plans or scope.
REQUIRED
Minimum 8 years’ Business Analysis and ecommerce experience.
Deep understanding of business requirements elicitation and stakeholder management.
Proficient in requirements gathering, business modeling, user journey modeling/documenting, project scoping, and use case creation.
High level proficiency in utilizing development, data, and business process analysis tools/utilities (SDLC, Business Process models, use case modeling, context diagramming, functional decomposition).
Excellent interpersonal and diplomatic skills, as well as a positive attitude.
Exceptional communication skills, both oral and written, including presentation skills.
Proven leadership skills; demonstrated team-building skills with ability to influence and motivate team members that report to other groups in the organization.
Extreme responsiveness with a strong sense of urgency.
Adept at assessing issues with ability to devise workable solutions quickly.
Able to work independently.
Excellent organizational and planning skills.
Flexible; must be able to change priorities quickly, focus on new ones without distraction; able to deal with conflict and work under pressure to meet deliverable dates/timelines.
Experience in negotiating timelines and deliverables.
Proven experience in Agile/DevOps methodologies.
Strong process knowledge of Software Development Life Cycles.
Experience with executing project governance, including change control and issue/risk management.
Working knowledge of Project Management Tools (Confluence, JIRA, Microsoft Project, SmartSheets, etc.).
Ability and willingness to travel globally as needed.
Scheduling flexibility to meet the needs of the business including evening, weekend, and holidays; 24x7x365 operations; able to adjust work hours to accommodate global teams.
Recommended
BA in Business Analysis, Business, Information Technology, or equivalent.
Professional business analysis certifications, such as CBAP or CCBA.
2-5 years’ of retail business knowledge.
Experience in Ecommerce Solutions, specifically SAP Commerce Platforms.
Knowledge of Warehouse Management Systems, specifically Logistics Reply.
Experience with projects focused on infrastructures and software solutions.
Proficient in the use of the Google products: email, spreadsheet, document, presentation, analytics.
Knowledge of French, Spanish, Korean, Mandarin a plus.

Resume
